geneVariantDescriptions.description: BRCA1 V1804D lies within the BRCT domain 2 of the Brca1 protein (UniProt.org). V1804D results in colony size similar to wild-type Brca1 in yeast (PMID: 15004537), demonstrates homologous recombination and nuclear localization in response to mitomycin comparable to wild-type in culture (PMID: 30257991), and has transcriptional activity classified as similar to wild-type in one study (PMID: 17308087), but in another assay demonstrates decreased transcriptional activity in culture (PMID: 15350310), results in reduced binding to Gadd45a and p21 promoters, and fails to rescue mESCs (PMID: 19770520) , and therefore, its effect on Brca1 protein function is unknown.

references.title: Functional characterization of BRCA1 sequence variants using a yeast small colony phenotype assay.
The effects of BRCA1 missense variants V1804D and M1628T on transcriptional activity.
Determination of cancer risk associated with germ line BRCA1 missense variants by functional analysis.
Expression of human BRCA1 variants in mouse ES cells allows functional analysis of BRCA1 mutations.
Combining Homologous Recombination and Phosphopeptide-binding Data to Predict the Impact of BRCA1 BRCT Variants on Cancer Risk.
